page.title: 08EGMANTON ELM CLUB
page.content: The Elm Club was formed in 1982 as a result of social concern within the community. The club has an average membership of forty, with an average age of seventy years, who meet weekly in Egmanton Old School Hall. It is run by a volunteer committee and helpers. The aim is to provide a cooked meal for isolated housebound people and senior citizens to enjoy in convivial company and keep in touch with those who are sick. It is sponsored by Age Concern within the local authority of Notts. County Council who subsidise the rent and the food. Members are collected by a Social Service Bus or volunteer cars. Members then play various games and celebrate Birthdays. They contribute towards expenses and other money is raised by the games and sales.
